summary.intent: Fix incorrectly rendered AI coding agent logos in the frontend, starting with the Cursor logo which was visibly broken.
summary.outcome: Replaced the corrupted cursor-logo.svg (which contained a literal '404: Not Found' string) with the real Cursor SVG from Simple Icons, updated the CursorLogo component path in AgentLogos.tsx, and successfully committed after removing a leftover temp clone directory that was blocking the pre-commit hook.

repo: SVG logo assets live in frontend/assets/agents/ and are inlined into React components in AgentLogos.tsx via an agentLogoMap.
The project uses a husky pre-commit hook that runs the full bun test suite (1309 tests) before allowing commits.
tmp/clones/ is used for evaluation runs and can accumulate leftover directories (e.g., agents-eval-DtKspd) whose test files get picked up by bun, polluting the test run.
The project uses an 'rtk' command prefix as a task runner wrapper around standard tools (git, bun).
When an SVG asset fails to download/copy correctly, it silently stores the HTTP error body instead of failing loudly — here 'IN' letters were rendered as a fallback.

code.finding: CursorLogo component had a placeholder/wrong SVG path data that rendered as 'IN' letters because the asset file was corrupted.
File contained only 14 bytes: the literal string '404: Not Found', indicating it was downloaded from a URL that returned a 404 at some point during asset setup.

workflow: simpleicons.org/icons/<name>.svg is a reliable source for standardized tech brand SVG logos.
When SVG rendering looks wrong (letters instead of icon), check the raw asset file bytes first — corrupted assets are easy to overlook.
Before retrying a blocked pre-commit hook, identify whether the failure is related to the current changes or environmental noise (leftover temp files, stale caches).

friction: cursor-logo.svg was silently corrupted with HTTP error text instead of valid SVG, requiring hex inspection (xxd) to diagnose.
Pre-commit hook failed due to bun picking up test files from an unrelated leftover tmp/clones/agents-eval-DtKspd/ directory, blocking the commit entirely.
Initial user request was interrupted mid-tool-use, requiring the user to restate the prompt with additional context (the logo filename).
open_items: OpenAI Codex and OpenCode agents were identified as missing from agentLogoMap in AgentLogos.tsx but were not addressed in this session.
The tmp/clones/ directory has no apparent cleanup mechanism — leftover evaluation clones will continue to pollute bun's test discovery on future pre-commit runs unless gitignored or auto-cleaned.
